content.question: A particle travels along the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>-axis so that its velocity at time <math alttext="t greater than or equal to 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>â‰¥</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> is given by <math alttext="the derivative of x with respect to t, equals the sine of t squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="2.4ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. What is the total distance the particle travels from <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="t equals 2.7" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2.7</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

topic.text: 8.2: Connecting Position, Velocity, and Acceleration Functions Using Integrals

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
